Context: The George Brown College Foundation is a registered charity that raises funds for scholarships and bursaries, capital projects, and programming at the college. Partners and donors contribute financially to make education more accessible for students, and they also provide employment opportunities and mentorship. The Foundation has supported capital projects such as the Daphne Cockwell Centre for Health Sciences and the School of Design's relocation. There are various ways to support George Brown College and its students, including one-time donations or on-going contributions. Contact information for the Foundation is available on their website or social media hub, along with information about current campaigns and application deadlines. The phone number for inquiries is 416-415-2000, and TTY is 1-877-515-5559. Email inquiries can be made to ask.george@georgebrown.ca.
